page.title: 15RECREATION
page.content: HERE ARE TWO EXAMPLES OF A SONG AND RHYME CHILDREN USE IN THE YARD OF NORTH FIELD MANOR SCHOOL.WE CHANT A 'WHOSE ON' RHYME CALLED 'DIP'.HERE IS ONE OF THE 'DIPS':'DIP,DIP,DA-TION,CORPORATION HOW MANY BUSES IN THE STATION.'HERE IS ONE POPULAR SKIPPING SONG 'KNICKER BOY' I KNOW A KNICKER BOY HE'S DOUBLE JOINT- ED,GAVE ME A KISS AND MADE ME DISAPPOIN TED,GAVE ME ANOTHER TO MATCH THE OTHER, OH (SOMEONE) I'M TELLING YOUR MOTHER, FOR KISSING (SOMEONE) DOWN BY THE RIVER IF YOU LOVE HIM TURN AROUND,IF YOU DON'T TOUCH THE GROUND.IF YOU WANT TO MARRY HIM DO THE HIGH KICKS,IF YOU DON 'T END IN THE SPLITS.TOOK YOU TO THE CINEMA,SAT YOU ON HIS KNEES,SAID 'DARL ING (SOMEONE) WILLYOU MARRY ME?'
